metadata.title: CVE-2023-52893 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:gsmi: fix null-deref in gsmi_get_variableWe can get EFI variables without fetching the attribute, so we mustallow for that in gsmi.commit 859748255b43 ("efi: pstore: Omit efivars caching EFI varstoreaccess layer") added a new get_variable call with attr=NULL, whichtriggers panic in gsmi.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52893` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-generic - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-209-lowlatency - 4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1154-aws - 4.15.0-1154.167~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-azure - 4.15.0-1163.178~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1148-gcp - 4.15.0-1148.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1117-oracle - 4.15.0-1117.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-209.220~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1154.167~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.178~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1148.164~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1117.128~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
